models.name: assessmentResults
models.description: This table displays results from submitted care assessment forms in a tabular format. There is one record per response result, so multi-select questions may have multiple records for the same question, and questions that were not answered may not appear in the table. Each result group is associated with a task in [cm].[userActivity] and with a single assessment version, the content of which can be referenced in [cm].[assessments].

columns.name: personId
columns.description: Arcadia's universal identifier for the patient/member record. This identifier is subject to change over time.

columns.name: taskId
columns.description: Arcadia internal identifier for the care management task in which this result was recorded, which links to [cm].[userActivity].

columns.name: scheduledDate
columns.description: The date and time for which the assessment task was scheduled.

columns.name: completedTimestamp
columns.description: The date and time at which the assessment task was completed.

columns.name: assessmentId
columns.description: Arcadia's internal identifier for the assessment form.

columns.name: assessmentVersionId
columns.description: The upload version number of the assessment form completed; as assessments are revised in the application, the version available at time of completion is tracked.

columns.name: section
columns.description: The section tab in which the question appears.

columns.name: questionSequenceNumber
columns.description: The sequential order of the question as it appears in the assessment content.

columns.name: responseValue
columns.description: The response entered or selected by the user.

columns.name: nestedResponseValue
columns.description: If applicable, a secondary free-text response whose entry is contingent on the selected responseValue to the parent question.

columns.name: userId
columns.description: Arcadia's internal identifier for the user who completed the assessment.

columns.name: recompletedAt
columns.description: Indicates date that a task was recompleted.
